file_content.text: Blasted do-gooders.
Ah, did the delivery go well?
Yeah, we did your dirty work, you fraud! Now where's my cousin?
I'd be shocked if this piece of trash can answer that.
I doubt he knows.
Let's be civil. We're all friends here.
Dial it back, Corso.
Well, I'm glad one of you is reasonable.
You keep us waiting, I've got a few things to implant in you....
Answer quick, "doctor."
Whoa, whoa, back off there, soldier.
You're looking for Rona Riggs, right? Well, she's the one who thought you two would be right for the job.
Don't shoot the messenger.
Hehe. Just like the old days, eh, cuz?
Course, I'm a little more big-time now than ma and pa ever would have allowed.
Your cousin sure doesn't look like a farm girl anymore, Corso.
This is Rona?
Your smuggling ring? I always said that's the only kind a lady would ever get on my finger.
[Flirt] This was your job?
Ooh, Captain. Are you proposing already?
Ugh.
You look pretty small-time to me.
I'm not impressed.
What were you thinking, sending us to smuggle spice?
You set us up?
How could I resist? I remember how much my baby cousin loved all our little "pranks."
Rona, what... what happened to you? What are you doing here?
I'm the underboss for the Black Suns on this part of Coruscant! Not bad considering five years ago, I was shoveling ronto dung.
The Black Suns? You're a... gang member?
Gang leader! You think I should write home? Make ma and pa proud?
Sorry to be the one to tell you, but Corso's the only family you've got.
Your parents are dead.
They're all dead, Rona. Separatists got them.
Ha. After all that grousing about the big dangerous galaxy. Guess that showed them.
How can you say that? Don't you care?
I could use a Black Sun contact.
You looking for a partner?
Captain! What are you doing? We can't just leave her here like this!
Where else would I go? I've got power here. I leave, I just got to work my way up all over again.
The Black Suns are going to chew you up and spit you out.
You should leave.
I've always been into biting....
You know nothing about me!
The Vigo called me a "rising star."
We obviously came just in time. Come on, Rona. We're getting you out of here.
Poor, chivalrous little Corso... don't you get it? I don't need to be rescued. I chose this life.
It's her life. You don't get to make that decision for her.
Let her go, Corso.
Captain, if she stuck a blaster in her mouth, is it her choice to pull the trigger?
Save your heroics for your captain, Corso. Maybe you'll even get a kiss for them.
Listen to your captain, Corso. I'm no damsel in distress. And you're sure not my hero.
Go home. You're too good for this galaxy.
There's only two ways out of that life, sweetheart. With us, or in a body bag.
Listen to Corso.
This isn't what you wanted, Rona. We talked about wild adventures, not... smuggling spice!
You wanted to be like the captain, right? Thumb your nose at society and use your freedom to make a difference! You can still do that.
It was a nice dream. But this is where I woke up.
I'm sorry I dragged you into it. Go with your captain. Maybe you two can show me how to make a better life.
What percentage do they give you? I'll double it if you take your business to me.
Want to work for me?
Captain. I'm not really comfortable making that offer....
Double? Done! Just tell me where to send the profits.
Heh. Well, I guess that's one way to stay in touch... not, uh, what I would have preferred.
It was good to see you again, Rona.
My nurse is waiting for you in the underlevels.
Ah, Captain. And Corso Riggs. It's good to meet such generous souls in a place like this.
I'm Doctor Hope. I like to think of myself as a messenger of mercy, caring for the poor, forsaken citizens of the underlevels.
We don't need the pitch. Just tell us what you know about Rona.
I'd be happy to. But as a doctor, I must put the needs of my patients first....
Is that your real name?
Doctor Hope? Seriously?
The citizens of lower Coruscant call me that for the ray of hope I bring to their cramped and miserable lives.
I'm sure.
What do you need?
First, tell us if you've got the goods on my friend's cousin.
Tell me about Rona.
Rona. Yeah, she's a hot one. Kiss you or kill you, you never know.
You just tell us what you want and lay off talking like that!
Who knew Rona had such a gallant protector...?
Right. So, I've got some, ah, life-saving medications that need delivering.
Unfortunately, Coruscant Security only cares about the rich. They don't let anyone distribute, ah, medications, in the underlevels at all.
You better not be asking us to go after Coruscant Security.
I don't fight cops.
Where do I come in?
I don't want to get you... or me... into trouble with the law.
Those folks deserve a fair shake. We're not the blasted Empire!
I hate snobs.
I could see you were a woman of compassion.
Good man! I knew you had the spark of compassion in you.
The only way to get my meds down without getting stopped is to carry them inside a living body.
What?
They'll be safely stored in surgical plastic and implanted under the skin. My, ah, nurse can remove them on the other end.
No way am I letting you implant me with something!
You're out of your mind!
I'll do it. You just come along.
What a fine young man!
Don't give me that look.
Captain I used to serve with, he once swallowed a whole shipment of grenades to keep them under wraps. This isn't half bad.
I've done crazier things.
Ha. I wish I had a hundred just like you, Captain.
You still think this guy is on the up-and-up?
Corso? What do you think?
No. Doesn't mean he doesn't know Rona.
This was always Rona's kind of thing. Breaking the law to do good under the nose of a corrupt authority.
It's worth it if I get to see her.
I'll just need you to come with me a moment, Master Riggs....
I'll need you both to just come with me....
Perfect. These vials should stay sealed for at least twelve hours, no problem.
I'll tell my contact--ah, nurse--to expect you.
When we get back, Rona better be waiting.
Quit poking your nose in other people's business.
